The wall paneling becomes more elaborate here, carved at floor and ceiling with tiny flowers. The pattern seems to extend the full length of the long hallway without repeating.

node.name: Naarti'hhs'naartin, Men's Wear
node.description: Paneled in dark, fragrant sandalwood, the room is tasteful and bordering on austere. Its only decoration is a delicate herringbone pattern carved into the wood just below the ceiling, encircling the room. Small brass censers emit thin strands of blue smoke, filling the air with the scent of tiger lily incense.

node.name: Naarti'hhs'naartin, Women's Wear
node.description: Tiny wooden panels no larger than a Halfling's thumb cover the floor below from wall to wall, forming an intricate pattern of swirling waves. A large cabinet carved in the same pattern presides over the room, set between two bright oil lanterns. Before it sits a low table, and on the far end of the room a tall rack shares a corner with an array of wooden mannequins.

node.name: Eretesk's Jugs
node.description: It is hard to walk through this medium-sized shop without tripping over the clay jugs splayed across the floor. Eretesk's prized goods create something of a narrow, maze-like trail through the room as one navigates the stacks and piles of pottery products.

node.name: Uurlath's Clayware
node.description: Despite its small size, or perhaps because of it, Uurlath's tiny shop is extremely well kept. The tiled floor is swept clean of dust, and the clay walls show signs of recent washing. Narrow shelves line the walls, displaying the potter's wares.

node.name: Fragile Finds
node.description: Small and sparsely decorated, the sandstone shop offers a welcoming atmosphere all the same. A bright blue rug with golden tassels rests just inside the door, directly across from a liberally padded counter and a small painting on the rear wall. A pillow-topped pedestal stands tall and proud just in front of hexagonal window overlooking the busy street outside.

node.name: Porcelain Perfection
node.description: Smoothly woven white cloth hangs in folds from the cool sandstone ceiling to the matching floor in this sparsely decorated room. A single shelf draped with thick black velvet provides a sharp contrast not only to the light cloth around it, but also to the creamy white porcelain dolls sitting patiently on it, waiting for a home.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Portico
node.description: A semicircle of intricately carved white marble columns supports a roof that shades entering worshipers from the sky and frames the portico outside of the gilded doors leading into the temple. The portico is clean of the desert dust that invades the city, a result of the frequent sweeping of acolytes in service to the temple. Well-worn marble steps lead down into Hav'roth's Square.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Mhalush Rotunda
node.description: A tall statue of Mhalush stands upon an elaborate pedestal in the center of the rotunda. Light streams into the room through an encircling band of windows just below the level of the dome above. Vibrant murals depicting scenes from the life of Mhalush fill the gaps between the heavy ribs of the dome overhead. A small balcony hangs over the open passage leading further into the temple.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Grand Gallery
node.description: Columns of green marble carved into the shape of spiraling serpents look far too slender to support their loads as they shoot up to the wide ribbed vault ceiling high above. Rose windows along the sides of the gallery have been crafted in an ancient style that combines myriad unrelated pieces of stained glass into a single image. Frescoes painted beneath the round frames bring welcome colors into the gallery. A screened panel placed in a corner looks oddly out of place.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Sunrise Portico
node.description: Thick columns of gold-veined white marble stand in an arc at the edge of the portico, supporting a section of the domed temple roof. Complex lines with attendant symbols have been carved into the floor to record the fall of shadows from the columns at sunrise. A gracefully carved archway in the temple wall opens to a stairway leading down beneath the great structure.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Southeast Semidome
node.description: The entry of the main chamber of the temple is so vast as to give one the impression that they have stepped out of the building. Two thick pillars support the semidome ceiling, which rises up to a breathtaking height. Multi-colored light filters down to the floor from a band of stained glass windows beneath the semidome's edge. Thick red velvet rugs are carefully arranged on the floor for worshippers to observe the more elaborate ceremonies performed in the grand rotunda.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Vista Portico
node.description: A wide arc of gold-veined white marble columns supports one of the many domes of the temple and marks the boundary between the portico and the greenery of the sacred gardens beyond. Birds occasionally flutter into the wide space, seeking temporary shelter from the sun. An artfully carved archway in the temple wall reveals a stairway leading down below the main level of the temple.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Grand Rotunda
node.description: Four great pillars, each supporting a marble hemisphere, stand watch over the rotunda. The round floor stretching between them has been inscribed with a single huge geometric design set beneath a thick layer of glass. Multi-hued light fills the space, streaming down from an uncountable number of stained glass windows to reflect back up off the floor. High above the polished floor, the immense ivory expanse of the dome seems too large to be supported by the pillars and semidomes that hold it up.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Southwest Semidome
node.description: Shadows seem to linger in the corners, unwilling to surrender to the plentiful light found within the main chamber of the temple. A dark fresco adorns the curved interior face of the semidome above a band of stained glass windows formed mostly of deep red and purple panes. The black and red patterned tile floor is nearly covered over with thick black velvet rugs for worshipers to seat themselves on for the temple's ceremonies.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Northeast Semidome
node.description: A large fresco of Peri'el on the inside of the semidome looks out towards the grand rotunda past the two massive pillars that frame this portion of the great central chamber. A band of stained glass windows made predominately of green and turquoise colored panes fills the area with a cool light. Thick rugs of jade-colored velvet lie scattered across the tiled floor, ready to cushion the knees of worshippers.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Altar of Hav'roth
node.description: Sacred icons and ancient gold triptychs adorn the polished sandalwood shelves behind the ruby and gold altar of Hav'roth. Smoky strands of pungent incense drift out of censers placed around the altar to hang lazily in mid-air. Lofty tracery windows climb up the wall behind the iconic stands to the base of the semidome above, letting light flood across the altar.

Sacred icons adorn the polished sandalwood shelves behind the ruby and gold altar of Hav'roth. Lofty tracery windows climb up the wall behind the iconic stands to the base of the semidome above, letting light flood across the altar.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Passageway
node.description: Torchlight reveals the stone-lined passageway in all its plainness. The floor is well swept of invading dust and sand and no old torch stubs litter the floor beneath the sconces, all due to the hardworking acolytes of the temple. The faintest of breezes wanders through the basement tunnel, carrying a strangely musty scent.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Chamber of Life
node.description: Soft, gentle light fills the domed chamber, but no source of illumination is visible. In the middle of the room stands a circular raised stone dais padded with a large stitched mattress to rest upon before venturing back into the world. From somewhere out of sight one can faintly hear the sounds of a tranquil song.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Passageway
node.description: The passageway slips straight through the foundation of the temple, with torches to light the way. The air of the tunnel is cool to the skin compared to conditions outside, but it remains as thin and dry as any desert air. One would find little entertainment while escaping the heat though, for the walls and floor of the passage are quite blank and featureless.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Small Balcony
node.description: Towering high above the main floor, this tiny balcony straddles the border between the Mhalush rotunda and the temple's main gallery, giving a fine view of all who pass beneath. In a niche to one side, a small spiral staircase leads down to the main level, while a deobar ladder leads upward.

node.name: Temple of Hav'roth, Bell Tower
node.description: A narrow walkway extends around the perimeter of the round tower, allowing access to the big bronze bell that hangs in the middle. Daylight reflects back up into the tower from the golden-tiled domes of the temple. Beyond the tower, the roofs of the city stretch out to the south and east, while the palace glitters to the southwest, and the vermin-infested hovels of the Golden Heights sprawl in the northwest.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Columns of purple quartz rise stoically toward the vaulted ceiling high above, supporting the rough-hewn obsidian walls of the Temple. Embroidered gold carpeting marks a clear path beneath them, receding deeper into the shadowy confines of the structure. Wooden torches rest within iron sconces set high upon the columns, casting a dim, flickering light upon the area.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Darkness clings to the fringes of this narrow corridor, cloaking in inky blackness that which lies beyond. Barely discernible within the shadows are two passages branching off in opposite directions, their outlines made visible by the glowing coals of a brushed silver brazier that stands beneath a wall mural.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Plush pillows of a wide variety lie strewn about the floor, ready to provide comfort for those waiting to make their entrance into the main chamber. An obsidian dragon statuette stands at the center of the room, placed upon a raised pedestal. Several candelabras of purple quartz hold burning votive candles, their soft, flickering glow shedding scant illumination upon the area.

node.name: World Dragon Temple, Main Chamber
node.description: Polished obsidian walls supported by columns of purple quartz encircle the vast chamber where an overbearing stillness permeates the air. Rays of light filtering through the large stained glass dome high above bathe the massive altar in a profusion of refracted colors, adding to the serenity. Suspended beneath the circular balcony winding its way around the upper reaches of the chamber hangs a large tapestry.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Layers of heavy silk drape across the ceiling and down the walls of this chamber, obscuring the smooth obsidian texture beneath. Crystalline bowls filled with burning incense rest atop low tables, sending swirling plumes of smoke soaring aloft. Plush pillows lie strewn about the floor, absentmindedly forgotten by the pilgrims as they left to enter the main chamber.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Tzgaa orbs set high into the smooth obsidian walls cast their soft glow throughout the corridor, connecting the heart of the temple to the Western Tower.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Rising up through the center of the chamber spirals a wrought iron staircase, bordered by two large tables set to either side nearby. Ironwood bookshelves stand against the smooth obsidian walls, like solemn guards at their posts. Several tapestries hang within the gaps between them, displaying distinctively different images.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Tzgaa orbs set high into the smooth obsidian walls cast their soft glow throughout the corridor, connecting the heart of the temple to the Eastern Tower.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Wooden benches nestle against the smooth obsidian walls, following the gentle curve of this circular chamber. Short bamboo reeds lie upon the floor of tightly packed white sand, waiting for the next class to convene. Spiraling upward through the center of the room is a wrought iron staircase, its silhouette plainly outlined by the glow of several tzgaa orbs.

node.name: World Dragon Temple, Limestone Cavern
node.description: Tiny droplets of water fall methodically from the apex of the cavern, plummeting downward through the huge cleft in the floor. Carved-out handholds descend through the opaque clouds of steam rising out of the depths, disappearing into the darkness below.

node.name: Limestone Cavern, Hot Spring
node.description: Wispy tendrils of steam rise like ghostly towers off the surface of the spring, funneling through the huge cleft in the roof of the cavern. Small handholds carved out of the limestone create a means for ascending out of the sweltering heat. Off to one side is a narrow tunnel guarded by two S'Kra warriors, their crossed spears barring entrance within.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Wooden racks line the walls of this circular chamber, filled with an assortment of scrolls. Upon the domed ceiling is a masterfully rendered fresco, painted long ago by some unknown artist. There is no moisture present in the air, but a strong, musty odor lingers throughout the area.

node.name: World Dragon Temple
node.description: Numerous crates and boxes fill this cluttered room, some neatly stacked, others scattered here and there upon the floor. Several wardrobes caked with dust and grime lean against the obsidian walls like silent sentinels watching over the chaotic scene stretched out before them.

node.name: Hekipe's Locksmithery
node.description: Dried desert roses hang in garlands from the low ceiling to frame the small room, and a modest Musparan silk rug lies upon the floor. No more than a squared hole, a glassless window carved from the sandstone wall is shaded by a pair of painted wooden shutters, offering some respite from the city noise and desert wind. The young S'Kra Mur woman, Muspar'i's local locksmith, sits behind a clean sandstone counter, occasionally pointing out the shelf and hook of wares behind her to interested parties.
Rose garlands hang from the ceiling, and a rug lies upon the floor. A glassless window is shaded by wooden shutters. The locksmith sits behind a counter and in front of a shelf and a hook.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Lobby
node.description: Streaks from foot traffic cut through the grime to reveal cracked tiles composing the once majestic image of a dragon grasping Elanthia between massive jaws. From the walls to the ceiling, the entire room is in a complete state of disrepair, ravaged by the onslaught of time and unwelcome looters, squatters and miscreants.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Lobby
node.description: Nearly splintered in two, what used to be an ironwood desk clutters the room's western side. Crumpled papers and broken quills litter the floor, evidence that the broken furniture likely housed some of the complex's files. The layers of shredded documents upon the ground resemble the covering of ripped parchments still clinging to the walls like flaky sheets of bark to a birch tree.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Lobby
node.description: With a table stationed between two couches, the room was likely a lounge area for residents while the building was in operation. Now, however, the dilapidated furniture serves no more purpose than to exist as a perpetual eyesore in the collage of destruction.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Lobby
node.description: Overflowing bags of refuse border a broken door, the garbage left forever just footsteps from the dump neighboring the lot outside. It makes no difference, since the rest of the halls and rooms harbor the same grunge and filth. The rotting odor is also omnipresent, as if it oozes from all of the stained sandstone walls like an invisible slime.

node.name: World's End Apartments, West Landing
node.description: Looking more like trash flung haphazardly across the ground than an intentional embellishment, the shredded remains of a runner extend from the landing all the way to the end of the split-level hall. Insect carcasses congregate along the edges, with the occasional rodent skeleton joining the morbid death party. Wax drippings along the smoke-stained walls point to where candles used to light the area.

node.name: World's End Apartments, West Wing
node.description: The ratty carpet bunches unevenly in places, making travel inconvenient and precarious. Massive chunks are missing from the ceiling, revealing patches of the sky not obscured by neighboring buildings. The city's constant companion, sand, certainly does not shy away from imposing its presence here either.

node.name: World's End Apartments, West Wing
node.description: Notes of urban life trickle into the hallway from several holes in the roof. Every little noise echoes off the sandstone walls and travels in and out of the opened apartments. The splotched, threadbare runner fails to buffer the sound, creating the false impression that the complex is alive with residential commotion once again.

node.name: World's End Apartments, West Wing
node.description: Surprisingly intact, an end table leaning against the wall supports a small cactus in a clay pot. Though the vessel is chipped, the glazed facade still reflects the color of the drab runner flowing down the floor of the long hallway. Salt stains along the ceiling indicate where the desert rain, infrequent as it may be, leaks through the building's decaying roof.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Landlord's Suite
node.description: The mild and musty smell of incense still loiters in the master bedroom, obviously the most lavish, at least before the complex was deserted. Though its sheets and mattress are gone, the massive bed's ornately carved headboard speaks to the squalor in which the rest of the tenants lived. A large bay window, its stained glass covering the floor in a rainbow of jagged shards, provides a fantastic view of the city from this position atop the Golden Heights.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Dozens of feathers litter the ground from the ripped mattress lumped into one corner. The room is completely disheveled, with furniture upended and drawers unceremoniously uprooted from their stations. One may deduce that someone conducted a thorough, albeit destructive, search of the premises in the past.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Pointy pieces of glass jut from the edges of the traumatized window pane, painting a contorted, almost dreamlike panorama of the Musparan skyline. A bed rests against the wall at an unnatural angle, while a chair dangles from a sconce close to the ceiling. Perhaps a squatter happened by and sculpted the furniture into artwork with the few bits that remained in the room after the building's abandonment.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Pockmarks deface the floor, causing it to resemble a dried sponge due to the plethora of gouges and furrows. The pattern continues on the walls and what remains of the apartment's furnishings. What caused the damage is a mystery, though the overall effect is not out of sync with the rest of the building's pitiful state.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Small paw prints maneuver their way across the dusty floor. About the size of a domestic house cat's, the markings weave between the overturned furniture, and they grow markedly more blurry as they reach the far corner. A final glimpse at the end of the line betrays the hiding spot of a diminutive feline skeleton, the bones settled in the shade of a bed's unattached headboard propped against the wall.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Faint pastel paint coats the rough walls in spots. A mangled crib with several splintered rods rests in one corner, as if prepared to cradle an undead infant due to the furniture's condition -- one of intense disrepair and overwhelming neglect. Tastelessly completing the scene, a mobile crafted from sharp glass shards, limp cigarillo butts and rusty razor blades dangles over the petite bed.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: The room is completely empty, which proves slightly unnerving compared to the rest of the building's chaos. No decorations line the walls, and no carpet softens the floor. A single piece of paper adhered to the decimated door frame exists as the lone accoutrement.

node.name: World's End Apartments, East Landing
node.description: A faded runner travels the length of the split-level hallway. The rug's moth-bitten edges and multiple burn marks insinuate a lack of care for the fabric, much like the rest of the fixtures in the condemned building. Uneven holes in the roof provide limited illumination, fulfilling the job once held by the candle-less sconces affixed to the walls near the crumbling ceiling.

node.name: World's End Apartments, East Wing
node.description: Crude graffiti sprawls across the dingy walls, probably tagged by transients with no regard for preventing further damage in the ramshackle building. A pair of empty door frames, one on each side of the hall, exposes the abandoned flats beyond. Sand fills in the ragged gaps of the floor's faded runner, causing it to almost look whole.

node.name: World's End Apartments, East Wing
node.description: Missing doors, either stolen or destroyed, permit unrestricted access to the uninhabited flats on both sides of the hall. A curious metal rack hangs from the middle of the ceiling here. At first glance, the gnarled coils appear to be a piece of art, alien amongst the decidedly uncultured environment. However, it proves to be no more than a chandelier with all of its valuable crystals removed, placing it much more in line with the theme of devastation dominating the complex.

node.name: World's End Apartments, East Wing
node.description: Dark stains mar the walls at the hallway's end and match the ominous puddle soaked into the sandstone floor. Slight breezes filter in from the flats on either side of the corridor, their windows completely wrecked and their doors mysteriously absent. Empty sconces dangle from the walls as if they attempted to flee the dire situation around them but gave up out of sheer hopelessness.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Thin cracks spiderweb through the walls and ceiling, apparently defying several previous attempts at repair judging by the crusty globs of dried putty all over the sandstone. The floor is bare save for shards of glass previously owned by the window frame. A large rock nestles in a pile of the glinting wreckage.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Washroom
node.description: Initially used by the tenants as a communal lavatory, the facilities now supply a different utility. The bathing tubs, wash basins and even the chamber pots emit the pungent aroma of grain alcohol -- the new liquid alternative since the well ran dry. A single tiny window near the ceiling hinders ventilation, and the fumes contribute to feelings of dizziness rather quickly.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Ale jugs, cigar stubs and crinkled newssheets from years gone by carpet the ground. Smelling distinctly of samatak, it is obvious the abode has seen activity from parties more recent than the original dwellers. A single parchment adorns the wall, held in place by a bent nail.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: A few lopsided stools are situated around an overturned crate in the center of the sticky floor. The scene implies the attendance of squatters who use the space for illicit activities, especially judging by the empty alcohol bottles piled nearly to the ceiling in one corner. Unfortunately, one visitor seems to have emptied the contents of his stomach next to the busted door frame, forcing all who enter the apartment to pass by the stinking mess.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Indubitably the deserted residence of a chronic hoarder, the room is cluttered with an eclectic variety of worthless junk. A repugnant stench with unknown origins inherently worsens the already depressing situation. The only light entering the area comes from the hallway, as the apartment's window is completely blocked from view due to the fortress of garbage.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Broken bottles on the floor mix with the glass from the room's shattered window. Tattered curtains patterned with abstract dust images still grip a bent rod above the square hole, the edges of the fabric frayed from flapping unabated in the brutal desert winds. No furniture outfits the living space, the pieces assumedly removed by looters looking for some quick coin.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Ruined Flat
node.description: Bursts of soot cover nearly every surface, alluding to a fire that fortunately seems to have been contained to this one room. The charred corpses of furnishings rest in peace upon the floor, their dismembered remains strewn at odd angles. Light patches on the walls contrast with the blackness, exposing where framed pictures and other mementos hung in the apartment while occupied by a full-time tenant.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Abandoned Lot
node.description: Discarded junk fills almost every inch of the space along the adjoining privacy walls. Makeshift footpaths weave through the garbage for a navigable route, though one might question the rationale considering the repulsive stench. A short awning hangs over the broken door facilitating access to the building's interior, holes in the canvas revealing glimpses of the sky.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Abandoned Lot
node.description: Adjacent buildings huddle around the lot as if to peer inside and watch for any spark of activity. The crowd of stone spectators faces disappointment on a regular basis due to the utterly despondent environs. Most of the movement in the area emanates from scavenging rodents disturbing the mounds of trash collecting on the ground.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Abandoned Lot
node.description: An accumulation in one corner indicates the city's rubbish disposal depot resides on the other side of the lot's wall. Layers of grease, sludge and similarly unpleasant liquids decorate the sandstone's surface like an artist's splatter painting. The stagnant stink invades every nook and cranny while loitering in the air like a putrid fog.

node.name: World's End Apartments, Abandoned Lot
node.description: Muspar'i's north wall looms over the crowded patch of land, making the lot's barricades appear like matchboxes in comparison. Occasional gusts of wind brush sand off the nearby rooftops, causing it to rain audibly onto the piles of trash all around. Hardly any wind reaches this desolate space, resulting in a gut-wrenching odor that soaks into clothes and bodies alike.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Courtyard
node.description: A set of iron lamps has been hung from tripods to illuminate the dark flagstones between the gate and the stair for those that might traverse the courtyard. Those that wander beyond the soft glow of the lamps have nothing more than the dim light that seeps down into the enclosure to show them the way across the bare stone.

Darkly colored flagstones pave the courtyard, swept clean of any desert sands that may have blown in. The featureless stones leave no cover for any intruder that might have breached the gate of the old fort, giving the arrow slits high up on the walls an ominous character. A wide set of stone stairs leads up to the main entrance of the old keep.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Entryway
node.description: The tall main doors of the keep have been left open to allow the easy traffic of bank patrons to the wide stairs that lead down to the courtyard. Equally lofty windows flank the door with their aged iron shutters propped open, permitting a view of the flagstone courtyard and the passage of breezes rather than footsteps. Passageways lead both ways around the immutable stone core, drawing the visitor further into the old keep.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Passageway
node.description: Heavy, rough-cut wooden beams radiate out from the inner wall of the corridor overhead, matching the curves of the stone wall as the passage leads between the entrance and the deeper portions of the old keep. A few sconces hold torches to light the passage, but shadows still run freely through the dim hallway, and give the impression of movement at the edge of the senses.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Lightwell
node.description: The weighty darkness of a looming shaft overhead blankets the room, broken by soft light slipping into the void from higher levels. Potted plants scattered through the area reveal their value by displaying a gorgeous set of night-blooming flowers that fill the air with their heady scents. The great shaft overhead shares the scent with the rest of the keep, distributing it on the gentle breeze that drifts up throughout the building.

A few potted plants have been placed around the room to catch what light they can from the wide open shaft above them that runs up through the entire height of the keep. Far overhead at the top of the shaft are a set of skylights and mirrors to draw light down into the interior of the keep. The noticeable breeze here stands as evidence that the shaft provides ventilation for the building as well.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Passageway
node.description: The curved stone walls of the passageway are blank, save for a few strategically placed wall sconces bearing torches to light the way. Old rugs have been stretched across the floor to absorb the noise of passage, but seem to do a better job capturing the dust of the desert tracked in by bank patrons.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Main Hall
node.description: The central hall of the keep stretches out with a floor of wide wooden planks, which has been mostly covered over with a colorful variety of finely woven rugs. A few well-crafted benches and tables have been scattered about the room. The curved stone walls have been plastered over with pale ivory stucco and hung with various bits of history's passing. Even in this age, it is still the center of traffic within the old building.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Teller Windows
node.description: Whatever this area might have once been, it has long since converted to service the teller windows of the city's bank. A stout-looking stone wall has been put up and left unstuccoed to separate the tellers from any harm. All discussion on any transactions takes place through cast iron screens to ensure the security of the tellers and the bank's deposits.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Lightwell Balcony
node.description: A breath of cool air greets patrons upon the balcony, refreshing and exhilarating in its suddenness. Sweet and heady scents drift upon the gentle breeze that rises up from the darkness below while dim starlight filters down from the skylights above. Even in the pale light, a set of carpeted steps leading up to the top level is plainly visible.

A strong breeze pulls upward past the well-traveled balcony forming a wide half circle around the perimeter of the lightwell at this level. Daylight streams down from the skylights above to brighten the area, despite being nearly in the center of the great stone keep. Off to the side of the balcony is a set of carpeted steps leading up to the top floor.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Foreign Exchange
node.description: Unlike the teller windows across the hall, the exchange of coins is handled a bit more openly. An old stone-topped table has been set out with all the tools of the exchanger to allow the customer to see that everything is as they wish. The exchange official confers with a teller behind an iron screen from time to time in order to keep the number of coins on the table to a minimum.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Old Passageway
node.description: This old passage once connected the main hall with the southern towers of the keep, but has been converted into a sitting room. Well-padded benches cluster around imported wooden tables to give the bank patrons a place to smooth out any disagreements in their planned financial deals. A large old painting of a group of S'Kra hangs on the back wall, looking sternly down upon the room.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Upper Hall
node.description: The upper hall of the keep was once a storage space but has long since been converted to provide services to discerning customers. No ceiling has been put in place, leaving the heavy maze of thick wooden rafters exposed up to the inside of the keep's thick roof. Low slung and thickly cushioned furniture has been placed almost randomly about the open hall, just the thing for lounging after a long day in the desert heat.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Upper Lightwell Balcony
node.description: Shrouded in starlight, the balcony looks down into what would be an abyssal blackness if it weren't for the lights of lower levels leaking out into the lightwell. From somewhere in the darkness comes a delicate floral scent that wanders with the cool air. The mirrors that reflect light down into the well during the day are little more than shadowy shapes that linger beneath the skylights, which have been left open to catch the breezes of the night.

Just out of reach above the balcony, an amazing and intricate set of mirrors hangs beneath the skylights at the top of the great shaft. No matter where the sun travels in the sky, the mirrors catch the rays of light, and redirect them down into the lightwell. At the same time, the heated mirrors draw air up the shaft to be released out the skylights with cleverly arranged openings.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Sitting Room
node.description: A line of several comfortable looking armchairs, broken only by the occasional wooden table bearing refreshments, has been left under the eaves at the edge of the great keep's roof. The provided luxuries coupled with the breezes that pass in and out of the building from under the roof's edge transform the room into a cool retreat to wile away the hours safe from the scorching heat found outside.

node.name: Old Lata'arna Keep, Exchange Vault
node.description: For security reasons, steel grates have been added in the gaps between the eaves and stone walls to compartment the exchange vault from the rest of the floor. A pair of burly guards lurks in the corners of the vault, keeping an eye on all that enter. In the center of the room, an Olvi Moon Mage reclines upon a couch, his only job to maintain the moongate shimmering in the arch on the back wall.

node.name: Tuul Shho'i'yvvh-ur, Showroom
node.description: The floor of this small shop is laid with an exquisitely woven carpet showing the three moons in all their phases against a field of night blue silk. Several oil lamps are suspended from the ceiling on fine silver chains, their flickering light illuminating a polished teak case along the back wall. Centered upon the carpet is a low mahogany table covered with an ornate damask cloth.

node.name: Ferashi'ini's Forge
node.description: Smoke fills the air as Ferashi'ini toils over his anvil in front of a massive brick forge, creating weapons with precision and skill. His apprentice works by his side, keeping his master stocked with the supplies he needs and stoking the bellows to keep the fire raging. Underneath a soot covered sign, several finished weapons have been mounted upon a display wall, their blades gleaming in the light of the fire.

node.name: The Tiger's Eye, Showroom
node.description: Silken shadows enclose the shop's interior, circling the column of muted light that streams down from a stained glass window set into the gently curving ceiling. Arranged in the center of the room are three small stands of basalt, marble and sandstone, lining up with the points of a triangular floor inlay of burnished copper lines. Curving around the periphery of the door leading outside are narrow panels of dark glass, a barely seen gleam in the darkness.

Dark walls enclose the shop's interior with silken shadows, circling the column of amber light that streams down from a stained glass window set into the gently curving ceiling. Arranged in the center of the room are three small stands of basalt, marble and sandstone, lining up with the points of a triangular floor inlay of burnished copper lines. Curving around the periphery of the door leading outside are narrow panels of brown glass, softly outlining the exit.

node.name: The Sun Forge
node.description: The blended scents of oil, leather, and metal create the characteristic atmosphere of those rooms where the art of weapon repair holds sway. Rough sandstone floors are kept swept clean, though occasional stray glints in the corners betray metallic shavings that have escaped from the workroom somewhere in the rear of the building that Fekoeti uses to ply his trade.

node.name: Calabria's Daggers
node.description: A catalog rests on the rough wooden counter that divides the front sales area from the work area in the back of the shop. Knives, daggers and short swords in various stages of completion are heaped in baskets along the back wall. A sullen orange glow outlines the ill-fitting door that leads to the back room, evidently the forge to judge by the waves of heat that seep around the edges.

node.name: Shoipak's Weaponry
node.description: Wooden and metal racks littering the floor and hanging from the shop's sandstone walls display an array of well-crafted weaponry. A banner reclining along the far wall carries several sinuous marks.

node.name: Silver Simplicity, Shop Interior
node.description: Wan illumination gently glistens where it touches the many silver wares perched upon shelves inside this shop, leaving dark shadows to pool in the lee of the stone counter that divides the room near the far wall. A single, brightly lit lamp sits upon the counter, revealing that the merchant has not yet sought rest from the day's labors. A roughly-hewn stone door leads back outside.

Bright sunlight from the open door shines where it touches the silver wares inside this shop. Silver plaques crowd one another as they perch on mottled grey stone shelves lining the walls, each silently vying for attention as they stand among fellows of myriad shapes and sizes. A counter of the same stone divides the room near the far wall, preventing the casual peruser from reaching the more delicate wares beyond.

node.name: Silver Simplicity, Loft
node.description: Casement windows, now closed against the coming of night, let in a faint shower of moonlight to spill over the carpet and furnishings of this room. Shadows dance as the pale luminescence competes with the warm glow of a pair of brass lanterns situated atop costly birch cabinets lining the walls, forming an entrancing display if one were to stay and watch it for long.

High, arched ceilings and wide casement windows fill this room with light during the warm hours of day. Pale blue and green carpets woven with ivory geometric designs cover the cool tiled floors, providing the room's only color to combat the harsh whiteness of the plaster walls and furnishings. Costly birch cabinets line the free walls, their doors lined with fine mesh screens that shine softly when touched by light.

node.name: Muspar'i, Justice Office
node.description: One side of this small stone building is occupied by a large pile of sacks. Periodically, guards in the red and black uniform of Muspar'i carelessly and haphazardly toss additional sacks, containing some hapless prisoner's belongings, onto the pile. Near a narrow door, painted to match the justice officials' uniforms, sits a lone wooden desk.

node.name: Muspar'i, Justice Office
node.description: The only decoration in this bland chamber is a raised dais, on which sits a single chair. Used by the king's appointees to dole out justice, when they deign to make the trip to this room, the dais almost has the appearance of a throne. On the far side of the office, a ring of bars surrounds the area where the prisoners are kept, and a heavy iron-bound door leads to the front of the building.

node.name: Muspar'i, Financial Office
node.description: Stacks of paper wobble upon wooden desks, the desert heat belying the Zolurenesque quality of the room -- bustling clerks prove that bureaucracy is universal, even in the sweltering, eternally-summer sands of Velaka. S'Kra guards, armed with wicked dirks and belts bearing vials of brownish liquid, watch over the office's lockboxes.

node.name: Muspar'i, Peri'el's Retreat
node.description: A thin channel of water divides the sandstone cobbles of the square, lending a sense of calm movement to the residential area. Night winds stir the towering palm trees, spreading their shadowy fronds back and forth over the rooftops. Each palatial house has been angled to face the central masterpiece -- a fountain of the namesake goddess -- as if in permanent homage.

White limestone curbs border the golden sandstone cobbles of the square. A marvel of artistic engineering, a thin channel of water flows through the direct center of the street, clearly indicating the residential area condones only foot traffic as opposed to the bustle of mercantile transport. The palatial houses and towering palm trees lining the path are all angled to face the central masterpiece -- a fountain of the namesake goddess -- as if in permanent homage.

node.name: Muspar'i, Peri'el's Retreat
node.description: Every now and then, a passerby flips a coin into the fountain and whispers requests for peace and luck to the limestone goddess rising from the watery depths. The soft splashes mimic the water burbling through the dark furrow splitting the cobbled street. Rows of dark palm trees shelter the houses at this point of the square, reinforcing the neighborhood's angled symmetry.

Lirums thrown for luck into the fountain's basin glint brightly, shooting flickers of reflected daylight onto the limestone goddess to freckle her body with fleeting motes. The golden sandstone paving the street shimmers from the desert heat, creating the optical illusion of undulation along the ground akin to the watery furrow splitting the path. As with the neighborhood's other three points, the curbs form a right angle to direct the houses and palm trees straight toward the square's main attraction.

node.name: Muspar'i, Peri'el's Retreat
node.description: Gurgles from the central fountain follow the water as it flows into a narrow channel spanning the length of the street. Lights from the windows of Shorka's Palace squeeze through the tall palm trees overhead to stripe both the houses and cobblestone. Since all of the residences in the quiet neighborhood face inward, illumination dots the night from every angle of the square.

The quiet neighborhood basks in the presence of Shorka's Palace, which dominates the skyline at every point of the square. All of the houses sit back from the golden sandstone road, the rows of verdant palm trees casting wavering shade upon not only the residences but the central fountain as well. Clean water flowing from the sculpted basin diverts into a narrow channel spanning the length of the street, parting it into two walking lanes.

node.name: Muspar'i, Peri'el's Retreat
node.description: A few residents meander through the square, though most of the neighborhood's tourists are absent due to night's darkness enshrouding the communal fountain. A small manmade stream parts the sandstone street, and the water moves swiftly along its route like blood through a vein. The houses and palm trees, all facing toward the square's middle, enclose the area and feature the dim city skyline as their backdrop.

Encouraged by the neighborhood's relaxing atmosphere, residents and sightseers alike meander through the square. Many stop to gaze at the statue of Peri'el rising from the communal fountain's basin. A small manmade stream parts the sandstone street, funneling the influx of pedestrians to either side, though never far apart. The houses and palm trees, all facing toward the square's middle, enclose the area and feature the city skyline as their backdrop.

node.name: Khidu's Shop
node.description: Unlike the owners of most shops in Muspar'i's many mercantile districts, this shopkeeper goes to great lengths to decorate his store. The sandstone walls, normally a sedately tepid and uninspired color, have been painted in vibrant hues distinguishable, even from the street, through the store's two windows. Several tapestries hanging above and beside a jewelry case serve to further set the establishment apart.

node.name: Golden Nusse
node.description: Shadows would drown the tiny room, were it not for the open doorway. Various ragged rugs have been spread haphazardly atop each other on the floor, and brightly dyed gauzy fabric drapes from the ceiling to soften the stone walls. Several rock pedestals are arranged in a semicircle on the carpets, each holding a silken scarf as backdrop for a piece of merchandise. In the darkest corner, the attendant unobtrusively sips tea between customers.

node.name: Desert Jewels, Showroom
node.description: Soft tendrils of moonlight filter down from the abstract pattern of glass insets carefully placed in the vaulted ceiling, causing occasional sparkles of light to glint off a twisted confection of silver and brass chains that hangs from the room's peak. Brighter still is the tzgaa orb that dangles from the metallic construct, casting a cool blue-white radiance over a shimmering sandstone counter.

node.name: Rataraduum's Fine Jewelry
node.description: Bejeweled metal ornaments ostentatiously line the plush interior of a glass case, the display curving in a crescentic way across an otherwise drab and unadorned shop. Fastidious care is obviously paid the jewelry case, its imported velvet pillows fluffed, its fine glass unsmudged.

node.name: Silver Coin Inn, Common Room
node.description: The well-worn tread on the sturdy pine floorboards indicates the number of patrons whose tired feet have sought out the rest and comfort of this plain traveler's inn. A large stone hearth crackles at the far side of the room, adding cheerful warmth to the appetizing scents drifting from the kitchen. Tucked away into one corner, an unobtrusive staircase leads up to the guest rooms provided for those who cannot afford finer lodgings within the city.

node.name: Silver Coin Inn, Bar
node.description: A long polished bar stretches across the eastern side of the small tavern, flanked by a row of cushioned stools. Several large shelves built into the back wall behind the bar contain liquid-filled bottles and flasks of myriad sizes, shapes and colors -- testament to the widespread fame of the Silver Coin's taproom in providing beverages from across Elanthia.

node.name: Silver Coin Inn, Upstairs Hallway
node.description: Off-white walls and dark deobar wood paneling add little to the atmosphere of this plain yet hospitable hallway, providing a sense of dullness and familiarity that is both welcoming and a little unsettling in contrast with the predominately S'Kra culture of Muspar'i. A small table graces the end of the hall beneath a dusty oval mirror, a porcelain bowl filled with friendly white daisies set in its center.

node.name: Silver Coin Inn, Guest Room
node.description: A worn but freshly pressed yellow and blue quilt lies folded neatly upon the small double bed in the center of the room, its once-bright diamond pattern repeated in a threadbare throw rug. Freshly picked flowers nestled in a painted stone urn fill the air with a pleasant scent, adding to the room's determined impression of cheer despite the sparse furnishings.

node.name: Silver Coin Inn, Guest Suite
node.description: A wide bay window set into the far wall looks out over the sleeping city, beneath it resting a window seat covered in pale pink velvet on which to relax and gaze at the sparkling stars. A white four-poster bed draped with a delicate rose coverlet lies in one corner of the room, opposite a matching vanity set with an oval mirror where guests may check their appearance before descending to the tavern.

node.name: Silver Coin Inn, Gaming Room
node.description: Thick, choking clouds of smoke swirl about your head from the smelly cigars favored by the regular occupants of this tiny gaming room. A collection of wooden card tables and flimsy chairs are scattered about the cramped space, hastily pushed together or shoved aside as the gamblers change games and fortunes with each card drawn. An occasional curse rings through the air to drown out the whirr of cards and the clink of coins changing hands.

node.name: Muspar'i Traders' Guild, Market Plaza
node.description: Broken colored tiles arranged in a circular pattern brighten the sides of the plaza set between the walls of the Traders' Guild. Sturdy masoned tables are scattered about the area, in hopes of attracting the odd customer that wanders in from the dusty streets. Stone dragons expertly carved crest the tall wide arch leading out to the street, their wings and tails stretching to meet the limestone walls of the guild. On the opposite side stand the double deobar doors that lead into the main hall.

node.name: Muspar'i, Carousel Entryway
node.description: The dim lighting does little to eclipse a gem-studded frieze impressed into thick clay and limestone walls of this sheltered relief. The air is frigid with chill, warm lanterns offering little reprieve from the merciless desert night. An impressive mosaic of miniature tiles forms the cool floor, arrayed into the menacing image of a king cobra. Suspended overhead, countless gears, pulleys and weights form the strikingly complex and beautiful mechanism that drives the Carousel.

node.name: Muspar'i, Carousel Desk
node.description: Based down a short flight of steps lies a small, sparsely decorated administrative office. A worn blackwood desk occupies the center of this room, stacked with the bureaucratic paperwork and thick ledgers of the establishment, behind which sits a shrewd-looking Dwarven clerk. A small plaque hangs from the wall, directly above a large bin that is labeled Lost & Found.

node.name: Muspar'i, Carousel Booth
node.description: Cool and calm, this narrow chamber is insulated from the harsh environment and commotion of the lively streets through the thick limestone walls. Rows of slow-burning oil lamps suspended along the wall illuminate the booth, the light from their small flames dancing along the intricate patterns of an ornate golden door, adjacent to a polished silver lever that protrudes from the wall.

node.name: Muspar'i, Carousel Booth
node.description: Cool and calm, this narrow chamber is insulated from the harsh environment and commotion of the lively streets through the thick limestone walls. Rows of slow-burning oil lamps suspended along the wall illuminate the booth, the light from their small flames dancing along the intricate patterns of an ornate brass door, adjacent to a polished steel lever that protrudes from the wall.

node.name: Muspar'i, Carousel Chamber
node.description: A small jeweled chandelier suspended from the ceiling and populated with sweet, slow-burning wax candles highlights the neatly arranged highly wrought furniture in this cozy, comfortably furnished chamber. Spread across the center of the room is a fine Velakan rug woven through with elaborate patterns, upon which an antique ironwood table rests. A sturdy iron vault is securely fastened into the back wall, ready for your use.

node.name: Muspar'i, Carousel Chamber
node.description: A large jeweled chandelier suspended from the ceiling and populated with sweet, slow-burning wax candles highlights the neatly arranged antique furniture in this sumptuous, lavishly furnished chamber. Spread across the center of the room is a rare, luxurious Velakan rug woven through with elaborate patterns, upon which an ornamental gold table rests. A robust steel vault is securely fastened into the back wall, ready for your use.

node.name: Muspar'i, Carousel Booth
node.description: Cool and calm, this narrow chamber is insulated from the harsh environment and commotion of the lively streets through the thick limestone walls. Rows of slow-burning oil lamps suspended along the wall illuminate the booth, the light from their small flames dancing along the intricate patterns of an ornate copper door, adjacent to a polished steel lever that protrudes from the wall.

node.name: Muspar'i, Carousel Booth
node.description: Cool and calm, this narrow chamber is insulated from the harsh environment and commotion of the lively streets through the thick limestone walls. Rows of slow-burning oil lamps suspended along the wall illuminate the booth, the light from their small flames dancing along the intricate patterns of an ornate bronze door, adjacent to a polished steel lever that protrudes from the wall.

node.name: Muspar'i, Songs of the Sands
node.description: This small shop is cluttered with stands and racks bearing all manner of scrolls made of dozens of type of parchments -- some leathery, perhaps from certain desert beasts, while others appear to be of the highest quality paper. From somewhere, whether within the shop or one of the nearby buildings or from the street itself, can be heard a faint singing.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Courtyard
node.description: The black stone tower rises upward like the blade of a knife, spearing the night air. Shadows darken the finely decorated oak tables to either side of the path, but the bazaar is far from quiet, though its colors are muted by the darkness. Oil lamps filled with fragrant fuel sit atop each table, casting globes of warm light to illuminate the attendants' wares.

A great tower of black stone rises high overhead with a pair of massive double doors leading within. Its buttresses and outrunning columns cast long shadows across the courtyard, which is occupied primarily by two long tables of black oak set up to either side of the lane, displaying various wares to passersby. The bright buntings draping down from the tables' canopy create a daring splash of color, offsetting the other rather austere surroundings.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Preparation Hall
node.description: Long tapestries sewn in deep, rich colors drape the polished stone walls of the preparation hall. Stools and straight-backed chairs are scattered about for the use of those entering the arena and those waiting to join the line. The scent of sandalwood hangs in the air, drifting from incense burners placed in the four corners of the room.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Hall of Masters
node.description: The stone walls are dense and thick, draping the hall in a curtain of heavy, reverent silence. Every other panel in each wall is carved with images, alternating with clear crystal oil lamps that burn with strange blue flames. Those buried in the Hall of Masters lie at rest beneath the stone floor, their names engraved atop granite slabs turned dark with age.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Foyer
node.description: The entryway to the guild is sparse and utilitarian, but its seamless stone walls and heavy floor tiles are undoubtedly crafted from the finest of materials. A pair of massive double doors dominates the south wall, directly opposite the heavily carved archway leading into the Guildmaster's office. Two towering cobras with glittering emerald eyes watch over the hall from either side of the arch.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Armory
node.description: Three tall arches lead out from the armory, one on each wall opposite and adjacent to the eastern passageway. While the floorboards here are sanded, they are not polished, offering better traction when the weapons that line the walls are tested.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Aether Garden
node.description: By night, long shadows creep across the length of this garden, cast down from the tall walls that bracket two of its edges and the spidery tendrils of climbing vines that anchor there. The richly sweet scent of wood violets hangs in the air, for dozens of the little flowers gather in silent enclaves beneath black marble benches that bracket the crushed obsidian pathway.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Water Garden
node.description: Bubbling water provides cool music to the night, accented by the occasional larger splash as a water elemental grows bold in its play. The shallow pools wreathing the garden cast off a pale silvery glow, muting the colors of the flowers that surround them. Huge irises, dyed a deep indigo by the ambient darkness, twine around one large stone archway that leads down to the south.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Air Garden
node.description: The snowy flowers of the Air Garden lie closed against the chill night air, their soft fragrances made softer in repose. Pale sapphire lights move in a slow waltz around the curving paths as silent air elementals tend their charges.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Library
node.description: Dark mahogany paneling lines the walls but is barely visible, for every scrap of space against the wall is covered with shelving stacked neatly with books. A special crosshatched wooden shelf stands just to the right of the entryway, full of scrolls. Heavy curtains, made of a material that makes them seem to shimmer, drape over the three stone arches leading into the gardens, helping to keep dust and debris from outside at bay, preserving the precious stock of the library.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Electricity Garden
node.description: Pathways of gleaming black stone snake around the garden, forking abruptly before large marble pots of strange herbs. A faint, tingling energy hangs continuously in the air, filling it with a sense of unrelieved anticipation.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Fire Garden
node.description: By night the Fire Garden shines with elemental light. Tiny sparks of magic rest inside each gigantic crimson bloom, illuminating the flowers from within. The glowing petals cast soft shadows that dance about the steep rock formations that support them.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Earth Garden
node.description: The air seems thicker in the Earth Garden by night, filled with the muted but heady scents of a myriad exotic herbs. The stacked-stone trellises, draped with sleeping honeysuckle flowers, cast long, strange shadows across the pebbled paths.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Guildmaster's Study
node.description: Cool stone walls of pale grey granite, trimmed in dark-stained oak, enclose the study in an atmosphere of careful, contemplative elegance. A monstrous oaken desk dominates one wall, a thick silk rug stretching between it and the equally large fireplace across the room. At the desk, the guildmaster sits in a chair that just barely falls short of being a throne.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Meditation Room
node.description: Pale starlight streams in from the six expansive windows arrayed around the room, bathing the wooden meditation benches and floor tiles in a wash of soft shadow. The verdant palms whisper occasionally in a gentle air current coming from the entryway, causing their silhouettes over the intricate Sun Maze mosaic set into the floor to ripple.

node.name: Royal Library of Muspar'i, Foyer
node.description: In this circular foyer, deep brown silk shot through with coppery highlights flows from ceiling to floor, cloaking the room in its subdued luxury. Ivory-hued shearling carpets quiet footsteps, and delicate rosewood tables bear crimson-swirled glass vases filled with jasmine blossoms that suffuse the air with their honeyed scent. One curving wall is dominated by an arched sandalwood door surmounted by a winged solar disk.

node.name: Royal Library of Muspar'i, Archives
node.description: Panels of bleached raw silk cover the walls, the edges banded with a flow of green-shaded embroidery that creates an elegant frame for the orderly rows of volumes housed by the Royal Library. Stately columns punctuate the shelves, each entwined with a mosaic of vines swirling around a pattern of water lilies and scarabs. Low tables and plush chairs are scattered about the room, and little bowls of sandalwood shavings fill the air with a lightly musky scent.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Foyer
node.description: Soft, even light bathes the foyer, given off by a shimmering portal in the center of the north wall. A large tapestry hangs beside a tall statue of a S'Kra Mur Bard, her mouth open in song and one arm reaching out toward the colorful fabric. To the east, an ornate door stands open.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Guildleader's Office
node.description: A large curved desk is positioned to face visitors entering the office of the Guildleader. Several worn benches and chairs line the walls for students to wait or assemble for an impromptu class. Just inside the doorway, a glass display rests on a scorched iron tripod.

node.name: Heketha Theater, Jeweled Dragon Lobby
node.description: The interior of the theater glows with a multitude of hues, as the light from hundreds of candles flickers against a host of multi-colored panes in the stained glass domed ceiling. A plain white portal in the far wall leads backstage. Plush carpets dyed a deep wine-red hue head north towards silk-upholstered chairs. A bronze dragon statue, bold atop a carved pedestal, glistens from behind a veil of smokey illumination.

node.name: Heketha Theater, Carbuncle Seating
node.description: Flamewood chairs with scarlet silk velvet cushions rest upon a golden carpet. The metal sconces on the walls, cast in bronze, twist and swirl in serpentine patterns. Thick velvet tassels hang from their looping curves in heavy clusters.

node.name: Heketha Theater, Iz'natha Bar
node.description: The haze of tobacco and incense drifts through the room. Panels of rust-colored silk conceal the thick paned windows beneath their numerous folds. Pale ivory damask chairs set around several tables provide comfortable seating for those seeking refreshment either before or after a show.

node.name: Behind the Curtain, Backstage
node.description: Heavy cords descend from distant catwalks far above. A pair of black wool curtains fans out from behind the more opulent velvet ones and lead out towards the stage. An opalescent white door to the west and a stained oak door to the east lead to separate dressing rooms.

node.name: Heketha Theater, Twilight Stage
node.description: The curved lip of the wood-grain floor flares out into the darkened theater. A band of stamped platinum and gold has been inlaid into the rim. Curtains dyed a dark indigo fall as a backdrop behind the stage itself. Thousands of small, sparkling flecks wink from their thick velvet folds.

node.name: Carnelian Dressing Room, Backstage
node.description: A sphere of carnelian rests in the center of the room on a bronze stand. Thick red drapes cordon off part of the dressing room to assure privacy for large numbers. A wrought-iron mirror stands in the southeast corner, while a stained oak door leads to the area behind the main stage.

node.name: Opal Dressing Room, Backstage
node.description: Snowy lace edges the crest of the ceiling. Mother of pearl inlay courses along the floor trim. Panels of white silk drape from rods, dividing the room into quarters if need be. A gold-rimmed mirror hangs on the northern wall.

node.name: [Heketha Theater, Cerulean Seating]
node.description: Several chairs form neat rows along a willowy curve to provide optimal view of the stage. Their legs and seats have been joined together from linden wood, with a high arched back that allows S'Kra Mur to sit in comfort. Fine silver-blue silk cushions pad the ornate seating. The stage, straight ahead, rests dead-center in the midst of this section with steps flush against its perimeter.

node.name: Heketha Theater, Viridian Seating
node.description: Tiny emeralds have been set in spiral patterns on the back of each seat. Dragon claws clutching globes of malachite provide legs for the deep green velveteen chairs. A huge chandelier descends from the ceiling on a thick platinum chain. Bronze sconces accented by thick gold tassles hanging from their serpentine curves have been set into the walls.

node.name: Heketha Theater, Diamond Box
node.description: The theater box overlooks the jewel-box of seats below. The gemstone fixtures from all three sections catch the flickering lights from wall sconces and reflect them back. Tiny diamonds sewn on the sweeping velvet curtains covering the stage glisten brightly. There is not much one can miss from here, far above the rest of the audience. The gilded curve of the balcony has been brightly polished, and embraces the spiral stair winding back down below as a part of its design. You also see some plush white velvet chairs.

node.name: S'hhtrkith's Instruments
node.description: Meticulously placed with care upon the cushioned shelves circling the walls of this small sandstone shop are a variety of musical instruments. The tenaciousness of S'hhtrkith's gentle and tender hand in the care of his goods shows that he is a true believer in the bardic spirit.

node.name: Melodies of the Earth
node.description: Light from the desert sky pierces through an elaborate, imported stained glass window, spraying streams of rainbow luminance upon shelves of instruments. A wide counter spanning the length of the store separates the shopping area from the work and residence portions -- a stairway in the shadowy recesses of the shop stretches up to what presumably is a bedroom.

node.name: Dhralduum's Instruments
node.description: At almost all hours of the day, a haunting melody floats through the stifling air that is confined within the sandstone walls. Dhralduum's apprentices are tasked with ensuring the continuation of the music, that his masterful pieces should be experienced in harmony by all would-be customers.

node.name: Latanaara's Musical Wonders
node.description: Foamy white curtaining adds a scant touch of decadence to a droll sandstone interior, the decorative cloth overflowing from a table placed carefully in the shop's center. Upon the serene surface, numerous exotic instruments are offered up like gold and berries on an altar.

node.name: Ishamik's Instruments
node.description: This shop would likely pass as the city's version of somber surroundings, with the only remarkable additions to the drab sandstone setting being the black-painted door and an equally dark ebonwood table. Like corpses laid out for their mourning viewers, the shop's instrumental goods rest morosely upon the dark table.

node.name: Laniloti's Zurnas
node.description: Fanciful silk curtains offset a rainbow colored door in shockingly dissonant bright hues. Elaborately crafted instruments are creatively strewn about a likewise silk bedecked table in this shop's center, the wares seeming more like some jeweler's gewgaws than mouthpieces of a bard's musical talent.

node.name: Muspar'i, Street of Proprietors
node.description: A dark painted bench sits alongside a shadowy stone pot boasting a frothy explosion of blue and orange lilies, both of which flank the cut arch in the surrounding wall. The faint glow from a nearby window illuminates the wall's mosaic, showing its deep blue background and jagged lines of yellow and white tiles.

A painted purple bench sits alongside a stone pot boasting a frothy explosion of blue and orange desert lilies, both of which flank the cut arch in the surrounding wall. The wall's vibrant mosaic depicts a deep blue background with jagged lines of bright yellow and white tiles.

node.name: Muspar'i, Street of Proprietors
node.description: Golden flowering cactus and desert lavender line the cobbled road. Predominantly silvery-blue, the sparkling jewel-toned tiles continue along the abstract pattern of the wall's mosaic.

Golden flowering cactus and desert lavender line the cobbled road. Predominantly silvery-blue, the sparkling jewel-toned tiles continue along the abstract pattern of the wall's mosaic. Several small birds flit through the area, darting from birdhouses mounted on the surrounding palms.

node.name: Muspar'i, Street of Proprietors
node.description: Within the shadows of an ornately carved gazebo stands an exquisite statue of a young S'Kra Mur woman. Her arms are outstretched with a set of six glass spheres suspended between them, each one giving off a soft light of a different color. Carved stone benches amid a thick bedding of fragrant white linanthus surround the gazebo, making it the perfect spot for a quiet evening stroll.

Within an ornately carved gazebo stands an exquisite statue of a young S'Kra Mur woman. Her arms are outstretched with a set of six glass spheres suspended between them, each one depicting a different element. Carved stone benches amid a thick bedding of fragrant white linanthus surround the gazebo, making it the perfect spot for a quiet picnic away from the noise of the nearby community.

node.name: Muspar'i, Street of Proprietors
node.description: A dense growth of sand verbena complements the warm brown tiles that form a swirling mosaic across the sandstone wall enclosing the area. Fragrant desert lavender shrubs overflow their fat barrel planters, the vining masses of violet flanking the road to the east.

A dense growth of sand verbena complements the warm brown tiles that form a swirling mosaic across the sandstone wall enclosing the area. Several dappled thrush avoid the sun's heat by darting around and behind fragrant desert lavender shrubs in fat barrel planters. The blossoms flow over the containers in vining masses of violet, flanking the road to the east.

node.name: Muspar'i, Street of Proprietors
node.description: The glow from city lights dances across muted red and gold tiles along the wall. Elegantly displayed flame-red dragon primroses overflow from rectangular yellow planters. The appealing smell of spices and food wafts into the area from nearby vendors, the aromas mingling with the fragrant blooms.

Daylight dances across the vibrant red and gold tiles on the wall, giving it a bright, warm glow. Elegantly displayed flame-red dragon primroses overflow from rectangular yellow planters near the mosaic. The appealing smell of spices and food wafts into the area from nearby vendors, the aromas mingling with the fragrant blooms.

node.name: Muspar'i, Street of Proprietors
node.description: Pale wooden benches are positioned against the protective sandstone wall, which bears a blue and white tile mosaic that appears washed out by the dim light. Drifting over from nearby streets, the occasional soft strains of music echo through the still air.

Painted a soft grey, the ornate wooden benches are positioned against the protective sandstone wall, the continuing mosaic bearing tiles of dreamy sky-blue and whispy white. The melodious sounds of the nearby shops drift faintly through the still air, measurably quieted by the overhanging palms that surround the area.

node.name: Muspar'i, Street of Proprietors
node.description: Tiny tiles ornament the tall sandstone wall designed to enclose the area, creating a glimmering deep-blue facade of darkness against the pale background. Wide planters of dusky desert roses flank a stately arch and stand sentinel over the shadowy street that winds further south.

A bright mosaic of vivid tiles decorates the tall sandstone wall enclosing the area and creates a splash of aquamarine and turquoise against the desert-hued background. Wide planters of scarlet desert roses flank a stately arch cut into the wall and stand sentinel over the quiet street that winds further south.

node.name: Sevitei's Strange Smells
node.description: This small shop is piled high with bizarre objects, stacked on shelves and racks encircling the sandstone room. The odd ingredients and vials of unpleasant-smelling liquids are perhaps why Sevitei has a reputation for being the least successful alchemist and perfumer in Muspar'i.

node.name: Shasuro's Dyes
node.description: Vibrant silk drapes obscure the rough sandstone of this shop's walls, while lively banners parade about the upper echelons, interrupted by a curtained archway leading to the back room. Along the walls stand several large vats of dark, almost bubbling liquids and shelves of innumerable and quite unidentifiable alchemic concoctions and ingredients. The materials, all of dazzling colors of a wide assortment, animate what might otherwise be dull in appearance.

node.name: The Green Lady's Glasshouse
node.description: Water trickles over carefully placed rocks in a fountain that overflows to irrigate the plants of the greenhouse. Small trees are planted in the lush brown soil, surrounded by low shrubs and vines. A border of jadice flowers surrounds the gravel walk that winds its way among the plants as novices of the Order of the Green Lady continue their struggle to raise the healing herbs in the desert city of Muspar'i.

node.name: Tobriash's Workshop
node.description: A haze of pungent oily smoke belches from a tangled mass of copper piping, stinging your lungs and leaving a sticky film over the glass vials and jars that line the shelves along the wall. The counters are littered with dried herbs, spilled ink and bits of paper as the alchemist, Tobriash Merrybay, works at his craft.

node.name: Tysoeti's Hospital, Reception
node.description: A rack on the eastern side of this building contains numerous canisters of herbs of all shapes, strange looking liquids, insects, dirt and what appear to be the organs of unidentified animals. Opposite that bizarre display is a larger rack of finished potions born from the unpleasant mass of ingredients. An alchemist tends to the massive black iron cauldron resting at the center of the building and surrounded by a collection of misery-stricken sick and wounded.

node.name: Tysoeti's Hospital, Gaktrhn's Triage
node.description: Smoke hangs listlessly in the air all about the dimly lit triage hall. Amorphous halos hover around the flickering flames of oil lamps that sway gently over cushioned benches in recessed alcoves. In the center of the room rests an oak-framed settee draped with Musparan silk, upon which the healer awaits the arrival of new patients.

node.name: Uramih's Perfumerie
node.description: The overpowering smells in this shop, some sickeningly sweet while others are of a more tingling scent, serve as a testament of alchemists' fortitude that would make even the finest tanner, with all the rotting, tarry smells of their work, proud. As a stark contrast to the deluging nasal distinction, the shop is visually nondescript -- unappealing sandstone walls, unpainted wooden door, unremarkable wooden table.

node.name: Adashjkah's Perfumes
node.description: Even the dullest and most congested nose would be overwhelmed by the staggering assailment of conflicting smells sealed within this bastion of olfactory strength. Individually sampling the various perfumes within the shop's confines would serve as a virtual impossibility.

node.name: Vhorsit's Unguents
node.description: Unbelievably cluttered, the tiny shop has clearly seen better days. The slant to the walls, visible from outside, is also clear from within, and they lean precariously inward. Bits of dried plants and preserved animal parts are tacked to the walls at random intervals. At least partially cleared, a stained countertop displays a small collection of identical pots.

node.name: Velaka Desert, Path of Three Brothers
node.description: A smooth stone walkway passes through the tall metal gate that opens here, dust and sand giving way to small green shrubs and blossoming succulents. Stretching east and west, stone walls serve to protect the area from the harsh Velakan winds. Faintly carved into the sand-worn surface of the walkway lies the image of a goblet, pointing north further into the oasis.

node.name: Velaka Desert, Path of Three Brothers
node.description: Walkways from three directions converge in this area, meeting along the perimeter of a deep spring of saltwater. Protruding from the center of the splashing water, a large limestone fountain bears inset pieces of carved zenith spinel. Gnarled cacti rise out of the ground, surrounded by large sand-worn rocks.

node.name: Velaka Desert, Path of Three Brothers
node.description: Clusters of desert lilies huddle along the bottom edge of a layered stone wall that shields the surrounding area from the harsh desert winds. The dusty walkway extends north towards more houses and east further into the oasis. Barely visible beneath the sand on the path is the carved image of a stylized knife.

node.name: Velaka Desert, Path of Three Brothers
node.description: Enough sand has been cleared away to expose an intricately carved female S'Kra Mur along the full height of one wall. The walkway branches southeast further into the oasis, where tall shadows waver in the desert heat.

Enough sand has been cleared away to expose an intricately carved female S'Kra Mur along the full height of one wall. The walkway branches southeast further into the oasis, where vague outlines of tall cacti waver in the desert heat.

node.name: Velaka Desert, Path of Three Brothers
node.description: The north and east walls meet here in a sharp corner marking the boundary of the area, naturally lined by piles of sand of various sizes. Near the north wall stands a large rock carved to depict the image of a male S'Kra Mur. The unmistakable sound of trickling water drifts through the area, enticing in the unrelenting desert heat.

node.name: Velaka Desert, Path of Three Brothers
node.description: Bursts of green wildflowers litter the walkway, providing stark contrast to the muted color of the stone. On the east side of the path rests a massive smooth rock chiseled to depict the image of a male S'Kra Mur. A small opening cut into the sand-worn walls allows visibility of the sweeping dunes on the other side.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, War Room
node.description: Dark mahogany walls wrap the room in a sense of polished, practical elegance. There are no windows, assuring that those manipulating the figures in the sand set into a hollow in the oval table are as undisturbed as possible. Light streams down from a crystal chandelier hanging from a thick gold chain hooked to the ceiling.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Iron Hall
node.description: This hallway holds an air of solemnity quite apart from the other sections of the Tower. Home to non-S'Kra students of the guild, its tenants come and go, but all do so quietly. Even the elementals seem to avoid this hall, and the stone walls seem a trifle darker in appearance in this area.

node.name: Sho'hhs Migendaniis, Silver Hall
